intro: Triraphis abyssinica, commonly known as the Abyssinian triraphis, is a flowering plant native to Ethiopia. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants known for their distinctive leaf structures and often edible roots. The plant features slender, upright stems and small, triangular leaves with a waxy surface. Its flowers are typically greenish-white and clustered in inflorescences, contributing to its ornamental value. Triraphis abyssinica is adapted to arid environments, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
